samples.situation: I have had trouble all my life with depression, but this pandemic seems to be making it worse

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: I'm wondering if it is the pandemic that is making me feel worse?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I find it important to take care of my physical being first: eat well, drink water, exercise, get fresh air. Don't wear the mask if you can help it. Seeing smiles helps.

prefix_dialog.content: I haven't been exercising nearly as much since March. Maybe I need to start walking again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I personally don't know anyone who has died and my nurse friends say it is no worse than the flu. So I try not to worry. What I think about is so critical. I try to pray about what I can't handle, then move on, change my thoughts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Walking is GREAT! This is a lovely time of year too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have a friend who did get it and almost died. He is 40 and pretty healthy. His wife and daughter got it too. They just had flu-like symptoms, but he was in the hospital for 9 days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That was almost 3 months ago and he is still feeling the effects of it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So to recap, find a good friend, get exercise, eat well, talk to people who will try to understand you.  And of course, pray.  The survival rate is 99.996% so the fact that you know no one who died is good news. I had flu like symptoms before this all happened and I still have a cough. They spray the skies too, so I try to not live in fear. There are a lot of consequences to fear, your heart beats faster, you stress yourself out, so it's important to not focus on negativity for too long.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I like your idea of changing thoughts. That would help keep me from "going down the rabbit hole!"

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had a bad cough and got tested several weeks ago just in case. But I didn't have it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Here is a good saying -- if you want to change your feelings, change your thinking.  Feelings are like the tail on the dog, they follow thoughts. So keep your thoughts positive, cultivate an attitude of gratitude, even write a list of of things you are thankful for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: LOL! That's great!  I'll have to remember that "feelings are like the tail of the dog"!  That's a cheerful way of thinking about it!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
